class.name: EnumControl
class.javadoc:
A EnumControl provides control over a set of discrete possible values, each represented by an object. In a graphical user interface, such a control might be represented by a set of buttons, each of which chooses one value or setting. For example, a reverb control might provide several preset reverberation settings, instead of providing continuously adjustable parameters of the sort that would be represented by {@link FloatControl} objects.

Controls that provide a choice between only two settings can often be implemented instead as a {@link BooleanControl}, and controls that provide a set of values along some quantifiable dimension might be implemented instead as a FloatControl with a coarse resolution. However, a key feature of EnumControl is that the returned values are arbitrary objects, rather than numerical or boolean values. This means that each returned object can provide further information. As an example, the settings of a {@link EnumControl.Type#REVERB REVERB} control are instances of {@link ReverbType} that can be queried for the parameter values used for each setting. Kara Kytle 1.3

Constructs a new enumerated control object with the given parameters.
type the type of control represented this enumerated control object
values the set of possible values for the control
value the initial control value

Sets the current value for the control. The default implementation simply sets the value as indicated. If the value indicated is not supported, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. Some controls require that their line be open before they can be affected by setting a value.
value the desired new value
IllegalArgumentException if the value indicated does not fall within the allowable range

Obtains this control's current value.
the current value

Returns the set of possible values for this control.
the set of possible values

Indicates whether the value specified is supported.
value the value for which support is queried
true if the value is supported, otherwise false

Provides a string representation of the control.
a string description

class.name: Type
class.javadoc: An instance of the EnumControl.Type inner class identifies one kind of enumerated control. Static instances are provided for the common types. EnumControl Kara Kytle 1.3

Represents a control over a set of possible reverberation settings. Each reverberation setting is described by an instance of the{@link ReverbType} class. (To access these settings, invoke {@link EnumControl#getValues} on an enumerated control of type REVERB.)

Constructs a new enumerated control type.
name the name of the new enumerated control type
